title: Industry Veteran Bob Bordenet Joins New Penn Financial As Regional Vice President of Midwest Third Party Organizations
text:
Bordenet’s nearly three decades of mortgage industry experience, vast knowledge and expertise will help take our growth plan to a new level. Philadelphia, PA (PRWEB) July 21, 2015
New Penn Financial, announced that industry veteran Bob Bordenet has joined the company as regional vice president, Midwest Third Party Organizations (“TPO”), supporting wholesale and correspondent lending.
Reporting to Brian Simon, senior vice president and head of New Penn Financial’s TPO channel, Bordenet will lead the expansion of New Penn’s Midwest sales force, and garner relationships with regional brokers by perpetuating consistent, quality service from New Penn Financial. Bordenet will further develop and implement strategies that increase market awareness of New Penn’s broad portfolio of mortgage products and help brokers continue to deliver smart finance solutions to their borrowers.
“We are committed to further strengthening New Penn’s reputation as an industry leader and widening our footprint in that marketplace,” Simon said. “Our growth and sales efforts continue to prosper, and Bordenet’s nearly three decades of mortgage industry experience, vast knowledge and expertise will help take our growth plan to a new level. We are committed to effectively responding to the demands from our brokers, to help them meet the needs of their borrowers. This requires more account executives in key metro areas, and we are prepared to invest in top talent.”
Bordenet has held senior sales leadership roles for the past 20 years most recently at Stearns Lending and WesLend Financial; where he successfully piloted a lending division during intense market pressures.
About New Penn Financial:
New Penn Financial has become a leading nationwide lender by bringing expertise, extremely competitive rates on a broad portfolio of mortgage products, and exceptional customer service under one roof. Founded in 2008, and licensed in 48 states, the company and its reputation have grown rapidly under the guidance of a management team with years of experience in the mortgage industry. New Penn is headquartered in Plymouth Meeting, Pennsylvania and operates offices nationwide. New Penn is a Shellpoint Partners company. More information is available at http://www.newpennfinancial.com .
